avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a strong to storm force wind, sometimes deep wind slabs formed in the last few days in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
In particular at a distance from ridgelines places that are protected from the wind: More recent wind slabs are easy to recognise but can in some cases be released easily. Remotely triggered avalanches are possible in isolated cases. Caution is to be exercised on steep shady slopes. At transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack the likelihood of avalanches being released is greater.
The weather will be mild. Small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day. This applies in particular in steep rocky terrain, and at the base of rock walls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Snow depths vary greatly at high altitude, depending on the infuence of the wind. More recent wind slabs are to be found also areas not adjacent to ridgelines.
Over a wide area there is more snow than usual.
As a consequence of the strong to storm force wind, a crust formed on the surface during the last few days.
Towards its base, the snowpack is largely stable.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In particular adjacent to ridgelines in all aspects: The strong wind has transported the fresh and old snow significantly.
In particular transitions into gullies and bowls places that are protected from the wind: Fresh wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, especially on very steep shady slopes.
The weather will be mild. Mostly small moist and wet avalanches are possible. This applies in particular in steep rocky terrain, and at the base of rock walls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The more recent wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Snow depths vary greatly at high altitude, depending on the infuence of the wind. More recent wind slabs are to be found also areas not adjacent to ridgelines. In particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 1 (low) a little snow is lying in all altitude zones.
As a consequence of the strong to storm force wind, a crust formed on the surface during the last few days.
Towards its base, the snowpack is largely stable.
